Hosted by CECLA at Dancing Cricket Farm2011

Workshops in Permaculture with
Instructors: Charles and Julia Yelton

You can RSVP here but please contact CECLA directly to confirm your spot and arrange payment.

 

Dates: Three 1-day sessions.July 23, July 30, and One Saturday tbd in August

Times: 9:30 to 4:30.

Cost of Workshop: $50 (multiple workshop deal) to $65 (singleworkshop) per person per one day workshop.

General Workshop information: Maximum of 15 attendees per daily session, so please reserve early. Pre-registration is required. In all sessions,attendees will gain exposure to the topics listed, and have the benefit of using thefields and forests of the Dancing Cricket Farm to apply what they learned.


Session 1/July 23. Permaculture Site Design.

The morning will be on backyard/urban/suburban applications, and afternoon on broadscale permaculture.a. Garden-sized.• Elements and components of a permaculture garden.• Energy cycling.• Small scale intensive systems.• Microclimates.• Garden layout and design.• Season extension• Composting b. Broadscale.• Identifying resources and landforms.• Climate and microclimates.• Soils and water planning.• Design for catastrophe.• Orchards & grain crops.• Structural forests.• Animals.


Session 2./July 30.  Soil and Water

a. Morning – water• Water cycle.• Water conservation.• Water, food, and designing for community resilience.• Water capture and storage from buildings, springs, wells.• Ponds• Edible Aquaculture plants.• Swale construction for water and soil retention and erosion control.  • Grey water and black water systems

b. Afternoon – soils and plants• Components of soil and soil properties.• Building soil and soil rehabilitation.• Vermiculture• Growing plants for soil and compost building.• Plants by function• Edible perennials for Maine

Session 3/August TBD. Working in the Landscape and Energy in Permaculture.

Morning – Working in the Landscape• Zones, sectors, and natural systems.• Achieving natural balance• Herb spirals• Hugal cultures
b. Afternoon - Energy in Permaculture• Solar, wind, and water power• Active vs passive energy• Energy auditing your home• Ground source for heating and cooling• Solar hot water• Basics of designing and building a minimal PV system.

For more information, and to pre-register, please contact Samantha Manetti,CECLA Permaculture Coordinator, 207-650-7796, or sammanetti@gmail.com.Additional information will be on the CECLA website at http://www.thececla.org/calendar/
